description: HR and payroll platforms for managing employee data, compensation, benefits, compliance, and global workforce operations

vendors.name: Gusto
vendors.description: Full-service payroll and HR platform designed for small to medium businesses. Handles payroll, benefits, HR compliance, and time tracking with an intuitive interface. Known for ease of use and comprehensive features including health insurance administration, 401(k) integration, and automated tax filings. Ranked #1 on G2 for payroll in Fall 2025.
vendors.tagline: Modern payroll, benefits, and HR for small businesses

pricing.startup_discount: Contractor Only plan free for 6 months for contractor-only businesses

best_for: Businesses primarily operating in single or few states
Companies with mix of W-2 and 1099 workers
avoid_if: Require deep customization and complex workflows
Budget-sensitive with many add-ons needed (costs add up)

ratings.our_notes: Best-in-class for SMB payroll. Ranked #1 on G2 Fall 2025. Exceptional ease of use (9.2/10). Strong for companies under 100 employees. Costs increase with add-ons. Limited international capabilities compared to Rippling/Deel.

vendors.notes: Base price increased from $40 to $49/month on March 1, 2025. Add-ons: Time & Attendance Plus ($6/person/month), Priority Support ($6/person/month), Next-Day Direct Deposit ($15/month + $3/person), Health Insurance Broker ($6/eligible employee/month). State tax registration fees vary by state. Global EOR available at $599/employee/month (promotional pricing through Dec 31, 2025).

vendors.name: Rippling
vendors.description: Unified workforce platform combining HR, IT, payroll, and spend management. Manages entire employee lifecycle from hiring to offboarding including device provisioning, app access, benefits, and compliance. Modular pricing allows companies to select only needed features. Strong automation and integration capabilities make it powerful for tech-forward companies.
vendors.tagline: One platform to manage your workforce, from hire to retire
best_for: Companies with complex workflows and integrations
Teams needing device and app management
avoid_if: Very small team (under 20 employees) - may be overkill
Limited budget - costs scale with modules
Want turnkey simplicity (learning curve for full platform)

ratings.our_notes: Industry-leading all-in-one platform. Exceptional for companies wanting unified HR+IT. Highest G2 rating (4.8/5) with 10k+ reviews. Powerful automation but complexity can overwhelm small teams. Pricing not transparent - requires custom quote. Best value for mid-market+ companies needing multiple modules.

vendors.notes: Modular pricing means you only pay for what you use, but total costs typically range $25-50/employee/month with multiple modules. Setup fees may apply for initial configuration. Enterprise pricing (201-1000 employees) reported at ~$80/user/year for Core + $80/user/year for Payroll. No free trial - demo required. Watch for potential additional costs during implementation.

vendors.name: BambooHR
vendors.description: HR-focused platform designed for small to mid-sized businesses. Strong employee database, hiring, onboarding, time-off tracking, and performance management capabilities. Known for intuitive interface and excellent user experience. Better suited for companies prioritizing HR processes over payroll complexity. Offers optional add-on for payroll and benefits.
vendors.tagline: HR software that makes work better for humans
best_for: Companies prioritizing HR over complex payroll
avoid_if: Need advanced payroll as core feature (add-on only)
Very small team under 10 (may be expensive)

ratings.our_notes: Top choice for HR-focused SMBs. Exceptional ease of use (9.2/10 on G2). Strong performance management and employee experience features. Payroll is add-on, not core strength. Pricing on higher end for SMBs. 5-15% implementation fee on top of annual software cost. Great balance of functionality and usability.

vendors.notes: Flat $250/month for companies ≤25 employees, then per-employee pricing kicks in. Most businesses pay $12-22 PEPM with volume discounts. Implementation fee typically 5-15% of annual software cost. 15% discount for combining Payroll + Benefits. 7-day free trial available. Pricing not listed on website - requires custom quote based on company size and features.

vendors.name: Deel
vendors.description: Global payroll and compliance platform specializing in international hiring. Provides EOR (Employer of Record), contractor management, and global payroll across 130+ countries. Handles complex international tax filings, compliance, and benefits. Best for companies building distributed global teams without legal entities abroad.
vendors.tagline: Global payroll and compliant hiring in 150 countries
best_for: Companies hiring international contractors or employees
Startups going global without foreign entities
Companies with existing entities wanting global payroll
avoid_if: Need deep US payroll features (focus is global)
Concerned about FX fees (can be higher than competitors)

ratings.our_notes: Best-in-class for global contractor and EOR services. Covers 150+ countries with strong compliance. Users praise ease of use and payment reliability. Common complaints about FX fees being higher than dedicated money transfer services and occasional payment delays. Great for scaling globally but expensive at $599/employee/month for EOR.

vendors.notes: Global Payroll requires $1,000 setup fee per entity. SMBs can setup in 10 days, enterprises in 1-3 months. Currently supports 53 countries with native payroll engine (real-time calculations). EOR pricing is competitive but FX fees can add costs. Common praise: ease of onboarding, contract clarity, localized compliance. Common criticisms: pricing structure, FX fees, occasional payment delays.

vendors.name: Remote
vendors.description: International employment platform providing EOR, contractor management, and global payroll services. Operates own legal entities in 80+ countries for compliant hiring without entity setup. Flat-rate pricing with no hidden fees. Strong focus on compliance, security, and protecting companies from misclassification risk. Premium positioning with emphasis on safety and reliability.
vendors.tagline: Hire, manage, and pay global teams compliantly

tiers.name: Contractor of Record
features: Remote hires contractors on your behalf
Peace of mind for sensitive roles

pricing.startup_discount: Startups: 50% off first employee for 1 year, or 12 months for price of 10 on all employees, plus free contractor onboarding

ratings.our_notes: Premium global employment platform with strong compliance focus. Users praise reliability, timely payments, and responsive support. Owns legal entities (not reseller) in 80+ countries for better control. Premium pricing at $599/employee/month - on higher end of market. No hidden fees is major plus. Best for companies prioritizing compliance and safety over cost.

vendors.notes: EOR: $599/month (annual) or $699/month (monthly billing). No platform, onboarding, or offboarding fees for EOR and Contractor Management. Global Payroll has implementation fee and payroll delivery fee. ESOP administration available for $999/year (85 countries). Talent pool access $199/month. Startup discount: 50% off first employee Year 1, or 12 months for price of 10. Users report reliable payments, fair FX rates, intuitive portal.

vendors.name: Oyster
vendors.description: Global HR platform for hiring, onboarding, and paying international talent across 180+ countries. Provides EOR services, global payroll, and contractor management with focus on remote-first company culture. Features cultural integration tools, employee development resources (Oyster Academy), and compliance management. Competitive pricing with volume discounts for larger teams.
vendors.tagline: Hire global talent anywhere with confidence

tiers.name: Scale
features: For teams hiring 3+ employees via EOR

avoid_if: Asia-Pacific focus (some third-party partner issues reported)

ratings.our_notes: Strong global HR platform with employee development focus. Competitive pricing with annual savings ($1,200/employee). Users praise fast onboarding, responsive support, clean interface, and transparent pricing. Some third-party partner issues in APAC region. Oyster Academy and cultural tools differentiate from competitors. Scale plan offers good value for teams with 3+ employees.

vendors.notes: EOR pricing: $499/employee/month (annual), $599/month (monthly), or $699/month on some plans. Save $1,200/year per employee with annual billing. 30-day free trial for Contractor plan. May require refundable security deposit (1 month service cost) for new hires. Add-on costs for salary bands, visa sponsorship, premium benefits. Companies save $50k-200k per country vs entity setup. Scale plan (3+ employees) offers custom pricing and volume discounts.

vendors.name: Trainual
vendors.description: AI-powered training and documentation platform for systematizing business operations. Create SOPs, training materials, and onboarding processes with AI assistance. Features include role-based training paths, testing, completion tracking, and organizational documentation. Helps businesses scale by turning tribal knowledge into searchable, trainable content.
key_capabilities: Training path builder with roles & responsibilities
Test and quiz creation with tracking
vendors.use_case_example: A growing restaurant franchise uses Trainual to document all SOPs, create role-specific training paths for new hires, and ensure consistent operations across 20 locations. New employees complete training 40% faster with tracked progress.
best_for: Growing businesses needing to document processes
Teams wanting to reduce tribal knowledge dependency
avoid_if: Very small team (under 10 employees - minimum seat requirement)
Need advanced LMS features (use dedicated LMS)
Looking for free solution (no free tier)

ratings.our_notes: Excellent for documenting and training. AI-assisted content creation saves significant time. The $1,000 implementation fee is a consideration. Pro plan at $319/mo is sweet spot with dedicated CSM. Great for businesses systematizing operations.

vendors.notes: All plans require $1,000 one-time implementation fee. Base pricing for 10 seats, scales with additional employees. Strong for operational documentation and training but not a full LMS replacement. Gamification and testing features help with engagement and completion rates.

vendors.name: HeroHire
vendors.description: AI-powered recruiting platform designed for startups. Provides instant, trusted hires by using AI to streamline the hiring process. Focuses on helping early-stage companies quickly find and onboard qualified talent without traditional recruiting overhead.
vendors.use_case_example: A seed-stage startup needs to hire their first 5 engineers quickly. HeroHire's AI matches them with pre-vetted candidates, reducing hiring time from weeks to days.

pricing.note: Pricing not publicly disclosed - contact for details

best_for: Companies needing to scale hiring fast

ratings.our_notes: Focused on startup hiring niche. Limited public information on pricing and detailed features. Best for early-stage companies needing quick hires. Competes with Ashby, Lever, and JazzHR in the startup recruiting space.

vendors.notes: Startup-focused AI recruiting platform. Limited public pricing information available. Good for quick startup hires but may lack enterprise features.
